title: ICE: `Free regions in MIR for CTFE` with `feature(adt_const_params)`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust #![feature(adt_const_params)] #![allow(unused_must_use, incomplete_features)] pub const BAR: () = ice::<"">(); pub const fn ice() { &10; } fn main() {} ``` ### Meta ICE only occurs with debug assertions so the version is just "latest commit on master" ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Free regions in MIR for CTFE', compiler/rustc_mir_transform/src/lib.rs:406:5 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.57.0-dev running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu query stack during panic: #0 [mir_for_ctfe] caching mir of `ice` for CTFE #1 [eval_to_allocation_raw] const-evaluating + checking `BAR` ```
Backtrace
